content.description:
This interesting problem offers interesting moves on rock that's a little on the rough side.

SDS at an good undercling and contort your body (the vassal lean) as you work your hands along the steep arete. Gain a good jug and work up to the top. Can be done from a standing start at about V0+.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the north face.

content.description:
SDS at a pinch and a sloper and work your way up the blunt arete using knobs and edges to finish up a crystal slab. Can also be done from a standing start at about V0-.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the north face.

content.description:
SDS at a flake, set your feet and make one difficult move to gain the lip. Mantle over or for more fun traverse the lip for about 6' and then mantle over.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
On south side of the small boulder just right of

Serf's Up

.
